description: Detectives in South Yorkshire investigating the disappearance of Besfortha Bharaj, 22, and her three-year-old daughter Elia, have issued new photographs to help find them.
title: South Yorkshire police search for Besfortha Bharaj, 22
title_page: South Yorkshire police search for Besfortha Bharaj, 22 | Daily Mail Online
text:
Police have launched a fresh appeal to find a missing mother and her three-year-old daughter who have not been seen for almost a week.
Detectives in South Yorkshire investigating the disappearance of Besfortha Bharaj, 22, and her three-year-old daughter Elia, have issued new photographs in the hope it will help find them.
They were last seen on Thursday April 20 in the Shirecliffe area of Sheffield at about 12pm.
Detectives in South Yorkshire investigating the disappearance of Besfortha Bharaj (left), 22, and her three-year-old daughter Elia (right), have issued new photographs in the hope it will help find them
Ms Bharaj is white with a tanned complexion, around 5ft 5ins tall, of a slender build and with shoulder length dyed red hair.
She was last seen to wearing a brown hooded coat, black trousers, white trainers and carrying a black shoulder bag.
Elia was wearing a white long sleeved top, red scarf with a matching red and white 'Minnie Mouse' polka dot hat, dark trousers and white trainers.
A spokesman for South Yorkshire Police said: 'We have issued new photos of the pair and want to hear from anyone who might know where they are.
'Anyone with information as to their whereabouts is asked to call 101 quoting incident number 1193 of 20 April 2017.'
